newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends steady in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends steady in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended steady in the kerb market at 43.10 to the dollar on Wednesday as dollar demand balanced supply, dealers said.
The rupee was likely to open stable on Thursday, a dealer at Khanani and Kalia International (pvt) Ltd said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar.
The premium on the foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 7.40 percent, compared to the opening at 7.50 percent.
